info.document:
South African actress Minnie Dlamini married long-term boyfriend Quinton Jones in Cape Town on Saturday. And she looked amazing!

#BecomingMrsJones

A post shared by Top Weddings Africa (@topweddingsafrica) on Sep 16, 2017 at 9:26am PDT

Former Miss South Africa and fellow TV personality Basetsana Julia "Bassie" Kumalo shared a heartfelt message for the soon-to-be Missus Jones on Instagram hours before Minnie and Quinton would commit to "for better for worse, till death do us part".

She wrote: "As you walk down the isle today @minniedlamini may the peace of God that surpasses all understanding guard your heart and be with you. Remember "love is patient, love is kind,it does not envy, it does not boast, it is not proud, it does not dishonour others, it is not self-seeking, it is not easily angered, it keeps no record of wrongs. Love does not delight in evil but rejoices with the truth. It always protects, always hopes, always perseveres. Love never fails". 1 Corinthians 13:4-8. Congratulations to you and Quinton on your special day. Sending you all my love.ὉeὉ6Ὁ5Ὁc #IminiKaMinnie. (sic)

As you walk down the isle today @minniedlamini may the peace of God that surpasses all understanding guard your heart and be with you. Remember "love is patient, love is kind,it does not envy, it does not boast, it is not proud, it does not dishonour others, it is not self-seeking, it is not easily angered, it keeps no record of wrongs. Love does not delight in evil but rejoices with the truth. It always protects, always hopes, always perseveres. Love never fails". 1 Corinthians 13:4-8 Congratulations to you and Quinton on your special day. Sending you all my love.ὉeὉ6Ὁ5Ὁc #IminiKaMinnie #BecomingMrsJones #MrandMrsJones

A post shared by Basetsana Kumalo (@basetsanakumalo) on Sep 16, 2017 at 12:32am PDT

Minnie signed over her wedding's broadcasting rights to Multichoice, and fans will get to share her special day when 'Becoming Mrs Jones' -- a three-part documentary of the months leading up to the big "I do" -- is aired on Vuzu TV.

The pair tied the knot in a traditional ceremony in July.

In the meanwhile, we'll have to settle for the sneak peaks gifted to us by her celebrity guests. Those in attendance, included the likes of 'Idols SA' judges Somizi Mhlongo and Unathi Msengana, Anele Mdoda, Roxy Burger, Jarred Doyle and Criselda Dudumashe.

Minnie's stylist, Chyna Bee, also shared a video on Instagram as the blushing bride got ready to walk down the aisle. The pair tied the knot in a traditional ceremony in July.

Here are some of the snaps:

| Currently Happening | Finally Becoming Mrs Jones Ὀd὇0Ἷd I am soooooo loving this look. @minniedlamini you are BEAUTIFUL ❤️Ὀb #SouthAfrica #CapeTown #BecomingMrsjones #wedding #ChynaBeeStyling
